p: The respiratory coronavirus (CoV) causing SARS originated in China and ran from November 2001 to July 2003, with civet cats living in bat caves not identified as an intermediate host until 2017 [1]. The reported international incidence of SARS was 8422 cases with a mortality rate of 11%, higher in patients aged 65 years or older [1]. Since 2004, no known cases of SARS have been reported.
